title: The languishing young man: or, The love-sick sail-man's sorrowful lamentation for the loss of his beautiful Maria, who left him languishing at the point of despair. To which is added, Maria's kind answer at the last time of distress. To the tune of, If love's a sweet passion, &c.
publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the angel, in Gilt-spur-street without Newgate,
